p: To allow functional assessment of hydrolyzable tannin metabolic and regulatory genes in planta, a pomegranate hairy root culture system was established that produces a substantial amount of hydrolyzable tannins and is easily transformable (Ono et al., 2012). The hairy root culture system has been successfully utilized for genetic characterization of candidate hydrolyzable tannin biosynthetic genes in pomegranate, such as PgUGT84A23 and PgUGT84A24 involved in Î²-glucogallin production (Ono et al., 2016). Together with the recently published reference genomes (Qin et al., 2017; Yuan et al., 2017), pomegranate hairy roots hold great potential for functional genomics in the hydrolyzable tannin pathway.
